Ocean Maya Royale: Complete Resort Guide

Budget Adults-Only Hidden Gem

Last updated: January 2025

Ocean Maya Royale pulls off something rare: adults-only all-inclusive at budget prices. While competitors charge $600+ for adults-only experiences, Ocean Maya delivers the essentials—no kids, Caribbean beach, included drinks—for $200-350/night. It's not Excellence or Secrets, and it doesn't pretend to be. But for couples wanting adult atmosphere without adult pricing, this hidden gem near Puerto Morelos delivers honest value.

In This Guide

  • Overview & Vibe
  • Accommodations
  • Dining
  • Beach & Pools
  • Activities & Location
  • Practical Information
  • Pros & Cons
  • Booking Tips

Overview & Vibe

{<strong>Adults-Only on a Budget:</strong></p><p>Ocean Maya Royale proves you don't need to spend $1,000/night for adult atmosphere. The H10 Hotels property keeps things simple: no kids, Caribbean beach, decent food, included drinks.</p><p><strong>Key Stats:</strong></p><ul><li>324 suites (all swim-out or ocean view)</p><ul><li>Adults-only throughout</p><ul><li>Near Puerto Morelos</p><ul><li>4 restaurants</p><ul><li>Beach and pools</p><ul><li>Starting ~$200/night</p><p><strong>The Vibe:</strong></p><ul><li>Relaxed and casual</p><ul><li>Couples-focused</p><ul><li>Low-key rather than romantic luxury</p><ul><li>Value-conscious travelers</p><ul><li>More chill than party</p><p><strong>What It's Not:</strong></p><ul><li>Not Excellence or Secrets quality</p><ul><li>Not luxury service levels</p><ul><li>Not gourmet dining</p><ul><li>Not Instagram-perfect</p><p><strong>What It Is:</strong></p><ul><li>Genuinely adults-only</p><ul><li>Real Caribbean beach</p><ul><li>Drinks actually included</p><ul><li>Swim-out suites at budget prices</p><ul><li>Peaceful atmosphere</p><p><strong>Who Stays Here:</strong></p><ul><li>Budget couples</p><ul><li>Adults-only seekers on limited budget</p><ul><li>Travelers who value peace over luxury</p><ul><li>Repeat budget AI guests</p><ul><li>Couples who'll explore beyond resort}

Accommodations

{<strong>Suite Categories:</strong></p><p><strong>Privilege Junior Suite Swim Out (from $200/night)</strong></p><ul><li>420 sq ft</p><ul><li>Ground floor with pool access</p><ul><li>Step directly into shared pool</p><ul><li>King or double beds</p><ul><li>The signature option</p><p><strong>Privilege Junior Suite Ocean View ($220-280)</strong></p><ul><li>420 sq ft</p><ul><li>Upper floors</p><ul><li>Caribbean Sea views</p><ul><li>No pool access</p><p><strong>Privilege Suite ($280-350)</strong></p><ul><li>540 sq ft</p><ul><li>Living area</p><ul><li>Enhanced space</p><ul><li>Better views</p><p><strong>The Swim-Out Value:</strong> Swim-out suites at $200/night is remarkable—luxury properties charge $1,000+ for this feature. Quality is basic, but the concept is real.</p><p><strong>Room Reality:</strong></p><ul><li>Rooms are dated but functional</p><ul><li>Bathrooms are basic</p><ul><li>Beds are comfortable enough</p><ul><li>A/C works</p><ul><li>Don't expect recent renovation</p><p><strong>All Suites Include:</strong></p><ul><li>Mini-fridge</p><ul><li>A/C</p><ul><li>Safe</p><ul><li>TV</p><ul><li>WiFi (basic)</p><ul><li>Coffee maker</p><ul><li>Daily housekeeping}

Dining

{<strong>Four Restaurants:</strong></p><p><strong>Main Buffet</strong> Breakfast, lunch, dinner with international options. Quality varies—some items good, some forgettable. The primary dining venue.</p><ul><li>All meals</p><ul><li>Casual</p><ul><li>No reservations</p><p><strong>Piacere (Italian)</strong> Pastas and Italian basics. Better than buffet. Limited seating so reserve.</p><ul><li>Dinner only</p><ul><li>Smart casual</p><p><strong>Kurai (Asian)</strong> Sushi and Asian options. Decent for the price point.</p><ul><li>Dinner only</p><ul><li>Smart casual</p><p><strong>Grill</strong> Poolside/beachside casual with grilled items. Good for lunch.</p><ul><li>Lunch primarily</p><ul><li>Very casual</p><p><strong>Food Expectations:</strong></p><ul><li>Adequate, not exceptional</p><ul><li>Buffet is hit-or-miss</p><ul><li>À la carte restaurants better</p><ul><li>Breakfast is reliably decent</p><ul><li>Don't expect Secrets-quality dining</p><p><strong>Bars:</strong></p><ul><li>Pool bar</p><ul><li>Beach bar</p><ul><li>Lobby bar</p><ul><li>Basic spirits included</p><ul><li>Cocktails available}

Beach & Pools

{<strong>Riviera Maya Beach:</strong></p><p>The beach is legitimate Caribbean—the same sea luxury guests enjoy, just with less expensive loungers.</p><p><strong>Beach Features:</strong></p><ul><li>Caribbean beachfront</p><ul><li>Calm, swimmable water</p><ul><li>Loungers and umbrellas</p><ul><li>Beach bar service</p><ul><li>Snorkeling possible</p><p><strong>Seaweed Note:</strong> Near Puerto Morelos tends to have better seaweed conditions than some Riviera Maya areas, though it varies by season.</p><p><strong>Pools:</strong></p><p><strong>Swim-Out Pool</strong></p><ul><li>Shared pool for swim-out suites</p><ul><li>Direct access from ground floor rooms</p><ul><li>The property's signature feature</p><p><strong>Main Pool</strong></p><ul><li>Larger pool for all guests</p><ul><li>Swim-up bar</p><ul><li>Activities during day</p><p><strong>Pool Atmosphere:</strong></p><ul><li>Adults-only calm</p><ul><li>No screaming children</p><ul><li>Music but not party-level</p><ul><li>Relaxed vibe}

Activities & Location

{<strong>On-Site Activities:</strong></p><p><strong>Included:</strong></p><ul><li>Pool and beach</p><ul><li>Basic water sports</p><ul><li>Evening entertainment (varies)</p><ul><li>Fitness room</p><p><strong>Limited:</strong></p><ul><li>No extensive programming</p><ul><li>No spa (basic massage available)</p><ul><li>No kids' activities (adults-only)</p><ul><li>Minimal organized activities</p><p><strong>Location - Puerto Morelos Area:</strong></p><p>The property sits between Cancún and Playa del Carmen, near the sleepy fishing town of Puerto Morelos.</p><p><strong>Nearby:</strong></p><ul><li>Puerto Morelos: 10 minutes (charming, worth visiting)</p><ul><li>Cancún: 25 minutes</p><ul><li>Playa del Carmen: 25 minutes</p><ul><li>Cenotes: Many nearby</p><p><strong>Puerto Morelos Advantage:</strong></p><ul><li>Local restaurants (often better than resort)</p><ul><li>Authentic Mexican fishing village</p><ul><li>Less touristy than Playa/Cancún</p><ul><li>Marine park for snorkeling</p><ul><li>Local bars and cafes}

Practical Information

{<strong>Getting There:</strong></p><ul><li>Cancún Airport (CUN): 25-30 minutes</p><ul><li>Transfer: ~$60 round trip</p><ul><li>Taxi available</p><ul><li>Not walkable to anything</p><p><strong>What's Included:</strong></p><ul><li>Accommodation (all suites)</p><ul><li>All meals (4 restaurants)</p><ul><li>Drinks (basic spirits, beer, wine)</p><ul><li>Pool and beach</p><ul><li>Non-motorized water sports</p><ul><li>Evening entertainment</p><ul><li>WiFi</p><ul><li>Gratuities</p><p><strong>What Costs Extra:</strong></p><ul><li>Excursions</p><ul><li>Premium drinks</p><ul><li>Spa services</p><ul><li>Better WiFi</p><ul><li>Photography</p><p><strong>Best Time to Visit:</strong></p><ul><li>Year-round viable</p><ul><li>Peak: December-April (higher rates)</p><ul><li>Value: May-June, September-November</p><ul><li>Quietest: September-October}

Pros & Cons

{<strong>Why Choose Ocean Maya Royale:</strong></p><p>✅ <strong>Pros:</strong></p><ul><li>Adults-only at budget price (rare)</p><ul><li>Swim-out suites affordable</p><ul><li>Peaceful atmosphere</p><ul><li>Real Caribbean beach</p><ul><li>Near charming Puerto Morelos</p><ul><li>No pretense—honest value</p><ul><li>Good base for exploration</p><ul><li>Less crowded than mega-resorts</p><p>❌ <strong>Cons:</strong></p><ul><li>Dated property and rooms</p><ul><li>Food is mediocre</p><ul><li>Basic spirits only</p><ul><li>Limited activities</p><ul><li>Not romantic luxury</p><ul><li>Some maintenance issues</p><ul><li>WiFi unreliable</p><ul><li>No significant spa</p><ul><li>Not walkable to anything</p><p><strong>Who Should NOT Book:</strong></p><ul><li>Couples wanting romantic luxury</p><ul><li>Foodies</p><ul><li>Those expecting Excellence/Secrets quality</p><ul><li>Anyone needing reliable WiFi</p><ul><li>Travelers who want pristine modern facilities}

Booking Tips

{<strong>How to Book:</strong></p><p><strong>Best Approaches:</strong></p><ol><li>H10 Hotels direct (sometimes deals)</p><ol><li>Package sites (Expedia, Costco)</p><ol><li>Compare all-in pricing</p><ol><li>Watch for sales</p><p><strong>Suite Selection:</strong></p><ul><li>Swim-Out: The reason to book here</p><ul><li>Ocean View: Only if swim-out unavailable</p><ul><li>Request recently updated room</p><p><strong>Maximizing the Stay:</strong></p><ul><li>Use swim-out pool access</p><ul><li>Eat dinner à la carte (better than buffet)</p><ul><li>Explore Puerto Morelos town</p><ul><li>Book cenote excursions</p><ul><li>Don't expect luxury—enjoy the peace</p><p><strong>Best Value Strategy:</strong></p><ul><li>Book swim-out at lowest rate</p><ul><li>Supplement with Puerto Morelos restaurants</p><ul><li>Use as base for exploration</p><ul><li>3-4 nights is ideal length</p><p><strong>What to Request:</strong></p><ul><li>Recently refurbished swim-out suite</p><ul><li>Away from main pool (quieter)</p><ul><li>Ground floor (swim-out access)}

Frequently Asked Questions

How does Ocean Maya compare to Excellence or Secrets?

Not comparable in quality—Excellence and Secrets are several tiers higher. But Ocean Maya is 50-70% cheaper. If you need adults-only atmosphere and can compromise on food, rooms, and service quality, Ocean Maya delivers the essentials at budget pricing.

Are the swim-out suites actually good?

They're basic but functional. The pool access is real—you step out and you're in water. The rooms themselves are dated and won't win design awards. But at $200/night for swim-out access, the value is there if expectations are calibrated.

Is the food actually bad?

Not bad—mediocre. Buffet breakfast is decent. Dinner buffet is inconsistent. À la carte restaurants are better. You won't get sick, but you won't remember meals fondly. Consider supplementing with Puerto Morelos restaurants.

Is Ocean Maya good for honeymoons?

Only if budget requires it. Honeymoons typically deserve better quality. If you can stretch to Secrets or Excellence, do so. If Ocean Maya is what budget allows, it's adults-only and peaceful—not embarrassing, just not special.

Should I stay at Ocean Maya or a family resort at the same price?

If adults-only atmosphere matters, Ocean Maya wins. Same-price family resorts might have better facilities but include children everywhere. Choose based on whether peaceful atmosphere or property quality matters more.
